answers.answer: possible yeast infection. If you used any lubrications, sexual cremes, or condoms may be allergy.

It may be a bacterial infection.  A doctor would do a swab to find out if that is the case and prescribe the correct medication for you to use and possibly your husband too.The other condition it may be is a yeast infection called Thrush.  A swab test would confirm if this was the case.If you have a white discharge this usually indicates a fungal infection, a yellow and very smelly discharge would indicate a bacterial infection.You can purchase antifungal creams and pessaries from the pharmacy without a prescription.  There is also a one dose capsule that is called Fluconazole that treats fungal infections.  This too can be purchased from the pharmacy or on prescription.Do not use any soaps and shower gels when you wash.  Use non perfumed soap or ones that have a pH levels that suits our skins.  Do not wear any tight clothing like tights and trousers and only wear cotton underwear that is washed in non biological washing detergent.As a home remedy to alleviate the itching and soreness you can apply natural set yogurt to your washed and dried vaginal area.  This helps to cool down the soreness and itching and also helps to alleviate any inflammation.Taking antibiotics and having a high sugary diet or not controlling sugar levels if having diabetes can also bring on these symptoms.Hope you get sorted out soon.

question: I had sex three days ago with my husband as of lately I have been experiencing some itching on the lips and inside of my vagina, there is redness all over and my female is charge has change color slightly. what is my problem there is no problem urinating just by the touch.
title: Sexual Health
